page.title: 16THE SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: In the north of our rectangle stands the{sewage works.} There are a lot of{sludge lagoons and buildings and{tanks}near the sewage works, and the{River Calder runs{alongside.}The river{controls}the sewage from Dewsbury and some surrounding areas. The{liquid sewage goes back into the River Calder when {treated.}The{solid sewage}is made into a garden{fertiliser.}Greenhouses test the fertiliser, so that it can be sold for growing vegetables. If it rains hard and the store tanks are full the{untreated}sewage opens into the River Calder.
